name.value: FHIR Connectathon 14 - US Core - Problems and Health Concerns; format XML

description.value: FHIR Connectathon 14 - US Core - Problems and Health Concerns; resource format XML; test a FHIR server's Condition read and search operations for various search parameter combinations: patient, clinicalstatus and category.
Condition read and search operations
Enter a resource id for a valid Patient resource on the destination system.
Patient read operation using a known FHIR resource id on the destination system. The purpose of this test is verify that the Patient resource does exist on the destination system.
Perform the read operation for the user-defined Patient in the destination server.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Patient.
Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.

Confirm that there is at least one record returned. There could be other careplan records returned.
